com.polarion.platform

Interface ITransactionService


  • public interface ITransactionService
    Author:
    POLARION SOFTWARE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginTx()
      This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().begin(), which wraps all checked exceptions thrown by the UserTransaction.begin() into unchecked RuntimeException, so that the users don't have to handle them (since they are typically unhandlable anyway).
      boolean canBeginTx()
      Shortcut method to determine, whether a transaction COULD be open.
      void commitTx()
      This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().commit(), which wraps all checked exceptions thrown by UserTransaction.commit() into generic Exceptions.
      void endTx(boolean rollback)
      Shortcut for
      javax.transaction.Transaction getTransaction() 
      javax.transaction.UserTransaction getUserTransaction() 
      void rollbackTx()
      This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().rollback(), which wraps all exceptions exceptions thrown by the UserTransaction.rollback() into unchecked RuntimeException, so that the clients don't have to handle them (since they are typically unhandlable anyway).
      void setRollbackOnly(java.lang.String msg)
      Calls getTransaction().setRollbackOnly() and in addition registers a message for future exception that will be thrown by commitTx() in case somebody will attempt to commit this transaction.
      void setRollbackOnly(java.lang.Throwable th)
      Calls getTransaction().setRollbackOnly() and in addition registers a throwable cause for future exception that will be thrown by commitTx() in case somebody will attempt to commit this transaction.
      boolean txExists()
      Shortcut method to determine, whether a transaction is open.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserTransaction

        javax.transaction.UserTransaction getUserTransaction()

      • getTransaction

        javax.transaction.Transaction getTransaction()

      • txExists

        boolean txExists()
        Shortcut method to determine, whether a transaction is open.
        Returns:
        true if there is a open transaction

      • canBeginTx

        boolean canBeginTx()
        Shortcut method to determine, whether a transaction COULD be open.

        Unlike txExists(), this will return true if and only if beginTx() is permitted = there is no transaction (either active or after completion).

        Returns:
        true if transaction can be opened

      • beginTx

        void beginTx()
        This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().begin(), which wraps all checked exceptions thrown by the UserTransaction.begin() into unchecked RuntimeException, so that the users don't have to handle them (since they are typically unhandlable anyway).

      • commitTx

        void commitTx()
       throws java.lang.Exception
        This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().commit(), which wraps all checked exceptions thrown by UserTransaction.commit() into generic Exceptions.

        By intention this method declares checked exception, since all client should be prepared to handle commit failure in a proper way.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • rollbackTx

        void rollbackTx()
        This is a shortcut for getUserTransaction().rollback(), which wraps all exceptions exceptions thrown by the UserTransaction.rollback() into unchecked RuntimeException, so that the clients don't have to handle them (since they are typically unhandlable anyway).

      • endTx

        void endTx(boolean rollback)
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Shortcut for 
                if(rollback) {
                rollbackTx();
        } else {
                commitTx();
     }
        Parameters:
        rollback -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setRollbackOnly

        void setRollbackOnly(java.lang.String msg)
        Calls getTransaction().setRollbackOnly() and in addition registers a message for future exception that will be thrown by commitTx() in case somebody will attempt to commit this transaction.
        Parameters:
        msg -
        Since:
        3.3.1

      • setRollbackOnly

        void setRollbackOnly(java.lang.Throwable th)
        Calls getTransaction().setRollbackOnly() and in addition registers a throwable cause for future exception that will be thrown by commitTx() in case somebody will attempt to commit this transaction.
        Parameters:
        th -
        Since:
        3.5.3
